meanings.definition: Used to represent the sound of an explosion or impact.
meanings.sent1: Kerpow! The fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The superhero's punch landed with a loud kerpow.
meanings.sent3: As the magician waved his wand, kerpow! A burst of confetti appeared.
meanings.sent4: The thunder rumbled, and then kerpow! Lightning struck the tree.
meanings.sent5: The balloon popped with a loud kerpow, startling everyone nearby.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with great force.
meanings.sent1: He kerpowed the ball out of the park with a powerful swing.
meanings.sent2: The hammer kerpowed the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent3: The chef kerpowed the dough to flatten it for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The storm kerpowed against the windows, making them rattle.
meanings.sent5: The boxer kerpowed his opponent with a swift uppercut.

meanings.definition: An exclamation used to express surprise or excitement.
meanings.sent1: Kerpow! I can't believe we won the game!
meanings.sent2: When the magician pulled the rabbit out of the hat, the audience shouted kerpow!
meanings.sent3: Kerpow! That was an unexpected plot twist in the movie.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks display ended with a grand finale, and the crowd cheered kerpow!
meanings.sent5: Kerpow! The surprise birthday party was a huge success.
